A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie takes the Star Wars mythology in a new direction and has the flawed characters that make a saga truly compelling.  Everyone wants their favorite characters to be pure and good\, but in fact most of the Star Wars Characters have significant flaws and moments of weakness that have led to major events in the story.  
Obi-Wan "failed" at training Anakin and went into exile.  Later\, he gave his life to become a more powerful "Force ghost" and advise Luke.
Luke was too old to begin his lifetime training as a Jedi and as such didn't have the same foundation as other jedis.  This makes him susceptible to mistakes\, and more compelling and relateable.  The movie is shot well\, and the characters are beginning to flesh out well.
Still a little kitschy in certain parts that are obvious references to modern politics and society.  Shot well.
